awd_titl_txt: Molecular Engineering of Advanced Materials:  New           Polymerization Strategies for Synthesizing Main Group       Polymers
awd_abstract_narration: This award is made as the starter grant increment of Dr.                        Jeffrey Moore's Postdoctoral Fellowship in Chemistry Award                      insupport of his research at the University of Michigan. The                    main thrust of Dr. Moore's research is the development of new                   polymerization strategies for synthesizing macromolecules that                  contain main group elements in their backbone. These                            macromolecules are valuable intermediates for ceramics and                      other novel solid-state materials.                                                                                                                              The initial approach will be the synthesis of bicyclic                          cyclohexadiene monomers containing main group elements. The                     objective of these studies is to identify systems which can                     catalytically eliminate the inorganic substituents by                           simultaneously extruding an aromatic fragment. These reactions                  may be initiated by either cationic or anionic reagents. Once                   systems have been identified, model reaction studies will be                    used to optimize molecular parameters relevant to this                          chemistry.
